intro: Acacia mollis, commonly known as the silky acacia, is a shrub or small tree native to South Africa. It is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and feathery, finely divided leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in globular inflorescences, which are highly attractive to pollinators such as bees and birds. Its foliage is often covered in a fine, silky hair, contributing to its common name. Acacia mollis is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for xeriscaping in arid regions.

It is well adapted to dry conditions and can tolerate high temperatures. Acacia mollis is an important component of the local ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
distribution_introduced_art_desc: Acacia mollis was mainly introduced to areas with well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is commonly found in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
